definition: plain/informal/suitable/convenient/opportune/to urinate or defecate/equivalent to 就[jiu4]: then/in that case/even if/soon afterwards
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Even so, the on-the-go convenience of mobile banking is attracting users in the West.
sentences.chinese: 即便如此，移动银行的便利性也正吸引西方用户。

sentences.english: Let's jump right into the module you just wrote to demonstrate the convenience.
sentences.chinese: 为了证明这种便利性，让我们转到您刚刚编写的模块。

sentences.english: Using cluster analysis and factor analysis analyses the principal index and sub-index.
sentences.chinese: 利用因子分析对生活便利性的分指标进行分析。

sentences.english: Countries could enjoy similarly low interest rates and the convenience of common money.
sentences.chinese: 欧元国能同样地享受到低利率和共同货币的便利性。

sentences.english: Convenience and control are the key factors which promote the growth of connected air-conditioners (including smart air conditioner).
sentences.chinese: 便利性与控制也是促进互联空调增长的关键因素。

sentences.english: The advantages and convenience brought by cell phones are obvious .
sentences.chinese: 手机的优点和便利性是显而易见的。

sentences.english: The path to the future of fitness relies on massive data aggregation, social elements and convenience.
sentences.chinese: 健康的未来依赖于收集大量数据，社交元素和便利性。

sentences.english: It is possible to improve the user-friendliness concerning the box function.
sentences.chinese: 提高涉及存储箱功能的便利性。

definition: convenient/suitable/to facilitate/to make things easy/having money to spare/(euphemism) to relieve oneself
to facilitate/expedite/make convenient and fast/speed up
